intro: Melampyrum subalpinum subsp. angustissimum, commonly known as the narrowleaf burning bush, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats at high altitudes, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually reddish or orange, and it produces small, brown seeds that are dispersed by wind. This subspecies is notable for its ecological role in alpine ecosystems and its adaptation to harsh environmental conditions.
